Pork Sisig is a popular appetizer that originated from the culinary capital of the Philippines: Pampanga. This delicious dish can also be categorized as a main dish. Pork Sisig was invented by the late Lucia Cunanan. She is popularly know as Aling Lucing – the sisig queen.

Sisig is a Kapampangan term originated from Pampanga a province located at the northern part of the Philippines, Sisig also refers to Sizzling sisig, a Filipino dish made from parts of pig's head and liver, usually seasoned with (mayonnaise), calamansi and chili peppers.
